messages: 72a2809425a1addcda2c030fcc74ceea (19:23): test
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:25): win
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (19:26): wonders if css_projector has interesting highlight settings
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:26): doesn't get to show off his color scheme again.  ;_;
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:27): ScribeNick: 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:28): plinss: Anyone with new topics?
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (19:28): http://wiki.csswg.org/planning/cupertino-2010
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:30): plinss: k, no new topics.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:30): plinss: First topic, TPAC.  Need to set our dates.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:30): ChrisL: Request for monday/tuesday?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:31): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: Yes, from szilles and others.  Want to make sure everyone is available for nov 1 and 2.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:31): wonders what's going on in that other room
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:31): other room?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:32): html5 political discussions, I think
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:32): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: Two hotels around the venue, Hilton and something else.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:32): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: Early rates, roughly 110 euros/night.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:32): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: Cheaper in the center of Lyons, but it's further away, and no easy connection via public transport.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:33): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: Unless there's a strong objection to monday/tuesday, we should let the w3c know.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:33): RESOLVED: CSSWG meeting is on November 1 and 2.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:34): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: We also need to discuss at some point the dates/location of first meeting in 2011.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:34): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: Who's willing to host in 2011?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:35): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: There's a bunch of us who could host in the Bay Area.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:35): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: Probably fair to host in Bay Area after 2 meetings in Europe.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:35): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: I'd be happy to host. (Mozilla)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:36): howcome: Seems to be too early to set up dates yet.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:37): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: Anytime in March is good.  No good in February.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:37): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: MIT spring break is march 21-26, and thus probably the AC meeting.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:38): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: So, if we meet on the last week of March, or 2nd or 3rd week, it would be better.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (19:38): Easter 2011 is April 24
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:38): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: Let's stick with the idea of a March meeting hosted by Mozilla, and move on for now.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:39): TOPIC: CSS 2.1 issues

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:40): List of attendees:  Dean, Simon, Anne, Steve, Beth, Sylvain, Alex, Chris, Bert, Arron, Elika, 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01, Brad, Tab, Daniel, Peter, Hakon.
aaf7e3e6ef01f9f15be2bda292cac8b3 (19:40): http://wiki.csswg.org/spec/css2.1

104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (19:41): Present: Dean Jackson, Simon Fraser, Anne van Kesteren, Steve Zilles, Beth Dakin, Sylvain Galineau, Alex Mogilevsky, Chris Lilley, Bert Bos, Aaron Eicholtz, Elika Etemad, David Baron, Brad Kemper, Tab Atkins, Daniel Glazman, Peter Linss, H?•kon Lie
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:43): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Start with issue 60.
aaf7e3e6ef01f9f15be2bda292cac8b3 (19:43): http://wiki.csswg.org/spec/css2.1#issue-60
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:43): b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2: Issue 60 is from Anton Prouse and issues about z-index and stacking.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:43): b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2: There is no interop issues, it's mostly just cleanup and making sure that different parts of the spec agree.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:43): http://wiki.csswg.org/spec/css2.1#issue-60

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:44): b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2: I suggested minimal changes, and he accepted most of them, there's just a few things left.  I think we can get it closed in a few days.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:44): b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2: Mostly it's just terminology and a few other things that are confusing.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:44): b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2: Like intermixing "stacking order" and "painting order" and such.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:44): b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2: So, mostly editorial.  We'll try to close it.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:45): b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2: In 9.9.1, there are a few errors, but browsers follow Appendix E, which is the important one.
72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d (19:45): notes last time the CSS WG gathered 17 people in same room was long ago...
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:47): howcome: Seems like it's more than editorial, like #4 there.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:48): b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2: Yeah, #4 was the one actual error where 9.9.1 is out of sync with appendix E, but browsers do the right thing there.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:48): szilles: My suggestion is that we reaffirm that Appendix E is the normative text.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:49): howcome: Don't we already say that somewhere?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:49): szilles: I think we do, but it wouldn't hurt to affirm it as a Working Group.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:50): plinss: So we're agreed to accept Sylvain's changes?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:52): RESOLVED: Defer to Sylvain for resolution of Issue 60, Bert will verify when editing that the changes are only editorial.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:52): http://wiki.csswg.org/spec/css2.1#issue-69
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:54): In paged media where there is no viewport, a 'fixed' background is fixed with respect to the pa and is therefore replicated on every page."
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:56): s/pa and/page box and/
72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d (19:57): dino leaves
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:57): bradk: Should we mention something about box-decoration-break wrt fixed backgrounds?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:57): Arronei: Not in 2.1, but we'd have to in 3.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:58): szilles: What about bleeds?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:58): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Not addressed here.  Backgrounds on the page box may bleed, but not on the document.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:59): I thought sending over 587 ought to work?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:59): meh
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:59): howcome: There is a bleed property in gcpm.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:59): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0, 587 doesn't work.  104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 decided that.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:59): RESOLVED: In paged media where there is no viewport, a 'fixed' background is fixed with respect to the pa and is therefore replicated on every page."
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (20:00): page box
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:00): plinss: Issue #111
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:00): plinss: Font-weight bolder/lighter, synchronize with css3?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:00): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Did we want to do #71?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:00): Bert: I'm in the process of responding to that, but have email troubles.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:01): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: issue 73, peter was supposed to write a note?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:01): I thought that was the one that would work? what else is there?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:01): plinss: Not sure; it's been a while.  I'll check.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:01): oh well
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:01): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0, shrug.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (20:01): ACTION: Plinss find or write note for issue 73 by this afternono
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:01): noticed an ACTION. Trying to create it.
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:01): Created ACTION-209 - Find or write note for issue 73 by this afternono [on Peter Linss - due 2010-04-05].
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (20:01): s/nono/noon/
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:04): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Don't have a strong opinion on this.
72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d (20:04): thinks he needs antibiotics...
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:04): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: So Daggett's suggestion was to make bolder/lighter act as if there were only four weights.
72a2809425a1addcda2c030fcc74ceea (20:04): http://wiki.csswg.org/spec/css2.1#issue-111
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:05): ChrisL: As long as you can get to the other weights someway.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:05): szilles: This isn't great, but it's less bad than others.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:05): Bert: This is the same text as in the Fonts module?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:05): szilles: Yes.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:05): Bert: I'm okay with that.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:05): szilles: Obvious issue is, what do current browsers do with this?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:06): arronei: Currently, we test by having a list, and see if it's lighter or darker.  Purely visual.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:06): szilles: Does the suggested algorithm keep this same behavior?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:06): Arronei: Should.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:07): RESOLVED: Accept Daggett's changed (from Fonts), back into CSS2.1.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:07): plinss: Related is issue 156.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:08): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: ChrisL says "I'd prefer to see the mapping made normative."
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:08): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Different mapping from issue 111.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (20:08): http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/fonts.html#font-boldness
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (20:08): last bullet in the list
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (20:08): "If there are fewer then 9 weights in the family"
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:09): ChrisL: above that, it says "in typical cases", which makes it untestable.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:10): ChrisL: So, I'd like to drop that sentence.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:10): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: OpenType fonts use a numerical scale, but they may not line up with multiples of 100.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:11): ChrisL: 4th bullet gives you a more precise description of that.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:11): ChrisL: I've seen things like a font with weights like 400 and 250, and that's fine.  200 and 300 aren't mapped explicitly.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:12): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: You might actually want to map the 250 to 100.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:12): ChrisL: No, that'd expose more weights, but would put them in the wrong place.  If you need precise mapping, just use @font-face.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:13): plinss: I think certain platforms made fonts map their weights wrong to get around bad heuristics.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:13): ChrisL: I haven't seen platform-specific weight tables like that.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:13): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: I'm happy to make bullet 4 normative, but I'm less convinced about the other rules being normative.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:14): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: I think mapping fonts to weights can be messy, and we shouldn't define that in css 2.1

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:14): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: But after the font has been mapped into the CSS font-weight scale, then we can follow the guidelines in bullet 4 to find missing weights.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:14): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: That seems consistent.

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:14): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: The rules before that are about establishing the scale, and needs to be flexible to accomodate whatever twisted things we get into with fonts.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (20:15): wonders if jdaggett should be around for this discussion
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:15): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: So the specific changes for this would be to pull bullet 4 out of the list and remove "typical".
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (20:15): remove "default"
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:16): s/typical/default/
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (20:16): Chris: Replace "typical mappings" from the sentence below to "this mapping"
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:16): RESOLVED: Pull bullet 4 of the font-weight mapping rules out into its own paragraph, tweak wording to imply exactness, not "typical" or "default".
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:17): plinss: Next is issue 114.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:17): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: let's defer until 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 is back.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:17): plinss: Issue 115
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:18): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Summary should be "Zero clearance should be distinguished from not having clearance".

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:19): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: There are some cases in which you have clearance, but it calculates to 0, and the spec isn't clear about distinguishing this from no clearance.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:19): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Some things happen when there isn't clearance (margin collapsing, frex).
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:20): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: So these other behaviors should still trigger when there is clearance, even if the value happens to compute to 0.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:20): alexmog: Any interop issues?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:21): plinss: Do we have testcases for current behavior?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:22): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: I doubt we need any.  It would require very unnatural code.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:22): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: (to make 0 clearance act like no clearance)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:22): plinss: So do we have tests for clearance showing interop?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:22): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Sorta.  Clearance is not the most interop portion of the spec.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:23): arronei: According to test cases, we do have at least two browsers agreeing.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:24): alexmog: I'm not sure if the first change is just about this issue...
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:24): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Check the second email, it overrides that.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:24): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: We'd take everything *but* the first change from the first email, and then all the changes from the second email.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:25): RESOLVED: Accept 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d's proposals for issue 115.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (20:26): http://wiki.csswg.org/spec/css2.1#issue-115
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (20:27): all but the first change in http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-style/2009May/0186.html
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (20:27): plus changes in http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-style/2009Aug/0394.html
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:29): <br type=coffee>
